form.label: Splunk - SH - 07 - Audit Users - Dashboard - v2
form.description: Integrated with Chase's ID NOW System. When looking at Terminated Users under Worker Status, a Contractor may show as terminated but its possible that their contract is getting renewed so look at Contractor Expiration in that case

search.query: | inputlookup splunk_sh_index_audit_user_login_kv_store_lookup | eval Days_Since_Latest_Login = round((now() - Latest_Login_Updated) / 86400 ) , Days_Since_Earliest_Login = round((now() - Earliest_Login_Updated) / 86400 ) | eval Earliest_Login=strftime(Earliest_Login,"%m/%d/%Y %H:%M:%S") , Latest_Login=strftime(Latest_Login,"%m/%d/%Y %H:%M:%S") , Earliest_Login_Updated=strftime(Earliest_Login_Updated,"%m/%d/%Y %H:%M:%S"), Latest_Login_Updated=strftime(Latest_Login_Updated,"%m/%d/%Y %H:%M:%S") | `get_identity(User)` | eval Email=lower(Email) | rex field=Contractor_Expiration "(?<Month>\d+)\/(?<Day>\d+)\/(?<Year>\d+)" | eval Month = case( Month = "1", "01", Month = "2", "02", Month = "3", "03", Month = "4", "04", Month = "5", "05", Month = "6", "06", Month = "7", "07", Month = "8", "08", Month = "9", "09", true(), Month ) | eval Contractor_Expiration = Year . "_" . Month | eval Contractor_Expiration = case(match(Worker_Type, "EMPLOYEE"), null(), ( ! match(Worker_Type, "CONTRACTOR") AND match(Contractor_Expiration, "2001_01") ), null(), true(), Contractor_Expiration) | eval Worker_Type = case(match(User, "ADMIN|ITSI|EDGE|SPLUNK|TEST"), "Splunk", true() , Worker_Type) | fillnull value="Undefined" Login_Source Splunk_Role Splunk_Instance Name Worker_Status Worker_Type Cost_Center Termination_Date Contractor_Expiration Department Manager_SID Manager LOB Title Email City State Country LVDI_Version | fields User User_Length Earliest_Login Latest_Login Earliest_Login_Updated Latest_Login_Updated Days_Since_Earliest_Login Days_Since_Latest_Login Login_Source Splunk_Role Splunk_Instance Name Worker_Status Worker_Type Cost_Center Termination_Date Contractor_Expiration Department Manager_SID Manager LOB Title Email City State Country LVDI_Version | search User = "$User$" AND Days_Since_Latest_Login >= $Days_Since_Latest_Login$ AND Days_Since_Latest_Login <= $Days_Since_Latest_Login2$ AND Splunk_Role = "$Splunk_Role$" AND Worker_Status = "$Worker_Status$" AND Worker_Type = "$Worker_Type$" AND Name = "$Name$" AND Department = "$Department$" AND LOB = "$LOB$" AND Manager = "$Manager$" AND Title = "$Title$" AND Contractor_Expiration = "$Contractor_Expiration$" AND City = "$City$" AND State = "$State$" AND Country = "$Country$" AND Cost_Center = "$Cost_Center$" AND Login_Source = "$Login_Source$" AND Splunk_Instance = "$Splunk_Instance$" AND LVDI_Version="$LVDI_Version$"
| stats count by Days_Since_Latest_Login | sort 0 - Days_Since_Latest_Login
| stats count by Days_Since_Latest_Login | sort 0 - Days_Since_Latest_Login|rename Days_Since_Latest_Login as Days_Since_Latest_Login2
| stats count by Contractor_Expiration | sort Contractor_Expiration
| stats count by LOB | where LOB!="Undefined"
| stats count by Contractor_Expiration | where Contractor_Expiration!="Undefined" | sort 0 - count
| stats count by Login_Source | sort 0 - count
| stats count by Department | where Department!="Undefined" | sort - count | rename count as Rank
| stats count by Cost_Center | where Cost_Center!="Undefined" | sort - count
| stats count by Country | where Country!="Undefined"
| stats count by State | where State!="Undefined"
| stats count by City | where City!="Undefined"

panel.title: Report on users logged on including the last time they logged into Splunk

search.query: | lookup dnslookup clientip as Login_Source OUTPUT clienthost as Login_Source_Resolved | eval Login_Source_Resolved = lower(Login_Source_Resolved) | table User Days_Since_Latest_Login Name Email Title Cost_Center Worker_Status Worker_Type Termination_Date Contractor_Expiration LOB Department City State Country Latest_Login_Updated Splunk_Role Login_Source Login_Source_Resolved Manager_SID Manager Splunk_Instance LVDI_Version | sort 0 - Days_Since_Latest_Login

| rename City AS city , State AS region , Country AS country | eval city = if(city="Undefined", null(), city), region = if(region="Undefined", null(), region) , country = if(country="Undefined", null(), country) | fields city region country | eval city = case ( city="Work At Home" AND region="NJ", "Trenton", city="Work At Home" AND region="OH", "Columbus", city="Work At Home" AND region="PA", "Harrisburg", city="Work At Home" AND region="TX", "Austin", city="Work At Home" AND region="NY", "Albany", isnull(city) AND country="United States", "Wilmington", isnull(city) AND country="India", "New Delhi", isnull(city) AND country="Philippines", "Manila", city="Taguig City", "Taguig", city="Ciudad Autonoma Buenos Aires", "Buenos Aires", isnull(city) AND isnull(country), "Wilmington", true(), city) | eval country = case ( country="ARG", "Argentina", city="Wilmington" AND isnull(country), "United States", true(), country) | lookup local=true geolocate city region country OUTPUT lat lon | lookup local=true geolocate city country OUTPUTNEW lat lon | geostats count
